page.title: 02LANDSCAPE II
page.content: The area is gently rolling with no steep hills.The two main rivers,Morland Beck and the River Leith both flow into the River Lyvennet which joins the River Eden.Morland and Cliburn villages each stand near their rivers.The boundary between the older limestone and the newer red sandstone runs diagonally through the block.This is seen in the building materials and in the dry stone walls:Morland and Great Strickland of limestone and Cliburn of sandstone.The soils reflect this change with heavy,wet clay limestone soils and drier light sandy soils.The scenery is that of regular walled or hedged fields of mainly grass but with some barley and root crops.There are large conifer plantations as well.
